intro: Psychotria dwyeri, commonly known as the Dwyer's Psychotria, is a species of flowering plant in the Rubiaceae family. It is native to the tropical regions of Central and South America, particularly in the Amazon rainforest. The plant is characterized by its small, elliptical leaves and clusters of small, white to pale green flowers. It produces small, dark blue to black berries that are typically consumed by birds and other wildlife. Psychotria dwyeri is often found in shaded, humid understory environments within dense tropical forests.
